wesm commented on pull request #3374: ARROW-4123: [C++] improve windows linting
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3374#discussion_r246956443
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/build-support/run_clang_tidy.py
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,102 @@
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+import argparse
+import multiprocessing as mp
+import lintutils
+import sys
+from functools import partial
+import json
+import codecs
+
+sys.stderr = codecs.StreamReader(sys.stderr, 'replace')
+
+def _check_some_files(completed_processes, filenames_json):
+    result = completed_processes[filenames_json]
+    filenames = set(map(lambda s: (s+':').encode('utf-8'), json.loads(filenames_json)))
+    problem_files = set()
+    for line in result.stdout.splitlines():
+        for filename in filenames:
+            if line.startswith(filename):
+                problem_files.add(filename.decode('utf-8'))
+                filenames.remove(filename)
+                break
+    return problem_files, result.stdout
+
+if __name__ == "__main__":
+    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(
+        description="Runs clang-tidy on all ")
+    parser.add_argument("clang_tidy_binary",
+                        help="Path to the clang-tidy binary")
+    parser.add_argument("compile_commands",
+                        help="compile_commands.json to pass clang-tidy")
+    parser.add_argument("source_dir",
+                        help="Root directory of the source code")
+    parser.add_argument("--fix", default=False,
+                        action="store_true",
+                        help="If specified, will attempt to fix the "
+                        "source code instead of recommending fixes, "
+                        "defaults to %(default)s")
+    parser.add_argument("--quiet", default=False,
+                        action="store_true",
+                        help="If specified, only print errors")
+    arguments = parser.parse_args()
+
+    linted_filenames = [str(path) for path in lintutils.get_sources(arguments.source_dir)]
+
+    if not arguments.quiet:
+        verb = 'Tidying' if arguments.fix else 'Checking'
+        print("\n".join(map(lambda x: "{} {}".format(verb, x),
+                            linted_filenames)))
+
+    cmd = [
+        arguments.clang_tidy_binary,
+        '-p',
+        arguments.compile_commands
+    ]
+    if arguments.fix:
+        cmd.append('-fix')
+        results = lintutils.run_parallel([cmd + some for some in lintutils.chunk(linted_filenames, 16)])
 
 Review comment:
   Can you run flake8 on these file and fix the Python style issues (long lines, etc)? 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the

+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY

+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+import argparse
+import multiprocessing as mp
+import sys
+import lintutils
+from functools import partial
+import json
+
+_filters = '''
+-whitespace/comments
+-readability/todo
+-build/header_guard
+-build/c++11
+-runtime/references
+-build/include_order
+'''.split()
+
+_exclude_globs = '''
+*_generated.h
+*pyarrow_api.h
+*pyarrow_lib.h
+*config.h
+*vendored*
+*zmalloc.h
+*ae.h
+'''.split()

bkietz commented on pull request #3374: ARROW-4123: [C++] improve windows linting
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3374#discussion_r246981801
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/build-support/lintutils.py
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,77 @@
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+import os
+from fnmatch import fnmatch
+from pathlib import Path
+from subprocess import Popen, CompletedProcess, PIPE, DEVNULL, STDOUT
+from collections.abc import Mapping, Sequence
+
+def chunk(seq, n):
+    some = []
+    for element in seq:
+        if len(some) == n:
+            yield some
+            some.clear()
+        else:
+            some.append(element)
+    if len(some) > 0:
+        yield some
+
+def dechunk(chunks):
+    seq = []
+    for chunk in chunks: seq.extend(chunk)
+    return seq
+
+def run_parallel(cmds, **kwargs):
+    procs = []
+    for cmd in cmds:
+        if not isinstance(cmd, Sequence): continue
+        procs.append(Popen(cmd, **kwargs))
+
+    for cmd in cmds:
+        if not isinstance(cmd, Mapping): continue
+        cmd_kwargs = kwargs.copy()
+        cmd_kwargs.update(cmd)
+        procs.append(Popen(**cmd_kwargs))
+
+    complete = []
+    for proc in procs:
+        result = proc.communicate()
+        c = CompletedProcess(proc.args, proc.returncode)
+        c.stdout, c.stderr = result
+        complete.append(c)
+    return complete
+
+_source_extensions = '''
+.h
+.cc
+.cpp
 
 Review comment:
   arrow/cpp/ doesn't seem to contain any .cpp files. Is this necessary?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

 Review comment:
   Somehow we lost the explicit executable ${PYTHON_EXECUTABLE} here so we're relying on the shebangs, which won't work on Windows. It suggests that [this](https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/7b767edd981e35e2518428345e8c415dcb165204#diff-6725b893dfc969abac4f4ee39a3a317fR90) was what caused CI to fail

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: It is challenging to run the clang-format and cpplint checks on Windows out of the box, and it is not documented how to do so. I found that neither the {{format}} nor {{lint}} targets work correctly when building with Visual Studio 2015. We could use Docker, of course, but it would be nice to be able to run these tools natively on Windows
fields.summary: [C++] Improve linting workflow and documentation for Windows-based developers

comments.body:
cpplint cannot be run at all on Windows in its current form. We also need to be careful about how we invoke cpplint because Windows can't handle long commands (over 8191 characters, apparently)

Given that we have a list of cpplint exclusions in cpp/CMakeLists.txt already, and we are parallelizing cpplint with xargs, it would make sense to write a build-support/run_cpplint.py that takes an exclusions file, path to the cpplint script or executable, and parallelism options
We might be able to consolidate the linting logic that's in run_clang_format.py to avoid duplicating efforts
